result.execSummary:
The defendant David J Thorne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: PAY DIRECT TO CLERK OF COURT, ANY BOND APPLIES

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David J Thorne

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, David J Thorne, in custody, appeared with Attorney Alex Andrea.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(11:48) continuation of sentencing to go over plea questionaire and waiver of rights
Andrea - do not intend on withdrawing pleas and court can engage in formal colloquy with client - 
Deft - does not wish to withdraw either plea
         14CF73 Ct 2 - plea continued as no contest - waives rights & jury trial
         14CF132      - plea continued as no contest - waives rights & jury trial
Andrea - as of today the deft's credit has now changed to 274 days

Andrea - have agreement on restitution of $420 - ask that the $2000 cash bail be applied then the court costs go toward the bond and requests any balance of bond be put towards deft jail books in Dunn Co. and then down with him to Dodge - requests eligibility of earned release program
State - has objection to earned release program and challenge incarceration

COURT:  
14CF132 & 14CF73 Ct 2 - goes over plea questionaire and waiver of rights - finds both voluntary, willingly and knowingly - found deft guilty on Tuesday 12-16
14CF73 Ct 2 - 9 yrs - 4 yrs IC 5 yrs ES - not eligible for CIP & SAP
14CF132      - 3 yrs 6 mo - 18 mo IC & 24 mo ES
both to run concurrent
$268 on each
Rest of $420 to Julie Slobodnik - bond applies any balance after costs & rest be returned to deft on his jail books
credit as of today 274 days

Defendant, David J Thorne, in custody, appeared with Attorney Alex Andrea.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(3:37)   MULTIPLE CASES HEARD - 14CF22, 14CF73, 14CF88, 14CF132
Andrea - agreement to plea to Ct 2 in 14CF73 & 14CF132 - dismiss the balance of the files and not read in - 9 yrs prison with 4 yrs IC & 5 yrs ES - earned release - advises the deft to enter no contest pleas
State - victim rights have been complied with
Deft - 14CF73   - Ct 2 pleads no contest
          14CF132 - pleads no contest

State - addresses sentence

Mothers statement read in court by victim witness 
S.O. reads statement to court
Ms. Lande requests photographs be displayed
J.S. makes statement
State - requests restitution be submitted tomorrow
Lande - can have them within 24 hours
Andrea - no objection - argues sentence - introduces a photograph but does not want it labeled as exhibit just shown to DA & the Court - requests earned release program for deft - credit 271 days - 9 yrs prison w/4 yrs IC & 5 yrs ES - was just made aware of restitution today, reserves the right to look at it and request hearing
Deft - addresses the court
Court questions the deft

COURT:  pleas voluntary - finds deft guilty in 14CF73 Ct 2 & 14CF132
14CF73 Ct 2 - 9 years prison; 4 yrs IC & 5 yrs ES 
Credit 271 days
14CF132      - 3 yrs 6 months; 18 months IC & 24 mo ES
not eligible for CIP & SAP
restitution amount to be filed tomorrow 12-17-18
***each concurrent to the other ***
DISMISS:  14CF73 Ct 1, 14CF22, 14CF88
sentencing memorandum filed by A. Andrea

Defendant, David J Thorne, in custody, appeared with Attorney Alex Andrea.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(2:33)
Andrea - have matters resolved - no PSI - joint recommendation
State - family feels comfortable proceeding

COURT:  set for at least 45 minutes - bond continues

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
per email correspondences this matter is moved to status at 2:30 same date
on court's own motion - $2,000 bond (paid) - not to be returned but to be applied towards the $5,000 ordered (not paid) and cover all four files. cc to def via fax.

Defendant, David J Thorne, in custody, appeared with Attorney Alex Andrea.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron Olson & Holly Wood Webster.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(10:08)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
Andrea - requests continuance for status
State - doesn't object to continuance 

COURT:  have had prelim on 14CF73, waiver of prelim in 14CF132, had prelim in 14CF22, have not had prelim or waiver in 14CF88
set return date in September
BONDS CONTINUE
  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on July 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.
